|Title=Knowing the principles of treatment of an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals
|Description=None
|Topic=Management

Treatment includes rest, icing, NSAIDs and even oral corticosteroids (30 mg per day) for a short course of 3 to 5 days. Local cortisone injections are effective, but should be used as a second-line treatment, as spontaneous favourable evolution is the rule.

properties.question: What is the recommended initial treatment strategy for an acute attack of hydroxyapatite crystals?
properties.option_a: Rest, icing, NSAIDs, and oral corticosteroids for 3 to 5 days
properties.option_b: Aggressive physical therapy and high-dose opioids
properties.option_c: Immediate surgical intervention to remove the crystals
